body:
### Describe the bug

When cimporting libcpp.cmath there are a lot of warnings (from cython, rather than the C++ compiler)

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
from libcpp cimport cmath
```

this gives

```

```

### Expected behaviour

No warnings

### OS

Linux

### Python version

_No response_

### Cython version

3.0.11, master

### Additional context

I'm not completely sure right now where the "previous declarations" are.

I think the problem may be about the exception statements. In most cases these functions can't raise exceptions so I'm fairly sure `except +` is wrong for them. But that's a secondary problem to the question of what they're conflicting with.

comment_data.body: Right.... actually I'm being stupid here, and it's to do with running Cython in C mode rather than C++ mode. The extra `except +` are still a problem though but I'll close this and open a new issue.

title: [BUG] Warnings when importing libcpp.cmath
